meanings.definition: Clothes or linens that have been pressed with a hot iron to remove wrinkles.
meanings.sent1: She folded the freshly ironed ironings neatly in the drawer.
meanings.sent2: My mom does the ironings every Sunday to make sure we look neat.
meanings.sent3: The ironings were so smooth that they looked like they came from a fancy store.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to perfecting the ironings turned her into the neighborhood's go-to ironing expert.
meanings.sent5: The pile of ironings waiting to be pressed seemed never-ending.

meanings.definition: The act of pressing clothes or linens with a hot iron to remove wrinkles.
meanings.sent1: Ironings can be a tedious task, but the results are worth it.
meanings.sent2: After a long day, she finally finished all the ironings for the week.
meanings.sent3: The ironings seemed to multiply on their own, making her wonder if they were breeding.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the iron smoothing out the ironings was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent5: She took pride in her ability to turn wrinkled clothes into perfectly ironed ironings.
